meanings.definition: The act of cutting down or reducing expenses or costs.
meanings.sent1: The company's retrenchment led to many employees losing their jobs.
meanings.sent2: During the retrenchment, the family had to cancel their vacation plans.
meanings.sent3: The retrenchment of the budget left no room for unnecessary spending.
meanings.sent4: Her retrenchment of unnecessary items from her closet made it more organized.
meanings.sent5: The retrenchment of the menu options made it easier for customers to choose.

meanings.definition: The process of making something smaller or more compact.
meanings.sent1: The retrenchment of the bookshelf allowed for more space in the room.
meanings.sent2: The retrenchment of the packaging reduced waste and saved materials.
meanings.sent3: His retrenchment of the essay made it more concise and to the point.
meanings.sent4: The retrenchment of the map made it easier to carry on hikes.
meanings.sent5: The retrenchment of the design simplified the product for better usability.

meanings.definition: The act of withdrawing or cutting back on something.
meanings.sent1: The retrenchment of his involvement in the project surprised his team.
meanings.sent2: The retrenchment of her support left him feeling isolated.
meanings.sent3: His retrenchment from social media caused quite a stir among his followers.
meanings.sent4: The retrenchment of her time spent on hobbies allowed her to focus on work.
meanings.sent5: The retrenchment of resources for the event affected its success.
